docs.lead_paragraph: Democrats accused Republicans of using heated rhetoric that encouraged extremists to intimidate health overhaul backers. Republicans said Democrats were politicizing the issue.

headline.main: Final Votes in Congress Cap Battle on Health Bill
headline.print_headline: Final Votes In Congress Cap Battle Over Health

docs.snippet: After a final vote in the House, a package of changes to the health care bill headed to the president for his signature.

byline.contributor: Carl Hulse contributed reporting from Washington, and Sheryl Gay Stolberg from Iowa City.
byline.original: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN  and ROBERT PEAR

docs.lead_paragraph: The House of Representatives on Thursday gave final approval to the budget reconciliation bill containing a package of changes to the Democrats' sweeping health care overhaul. The bill, which Democratic leaders hailed as a landmark achievement, now goes to President Obama for his signature.

headline.main: It's Done: House Passes Reconciliation Bill

docs.abstract: The final piece of the Democrats' health care legislation goes to President Obama for his signature.
docs.snippet: The final piece of the Democrats' health care legislation goes to President Obama for his signature.

docs.lead_paragraph: Which of these assertions is the less plausible?
docs.abstract: When it comes to cases asking the Supreme Court to invalidate the new health care law, the justices seem likely to keep history's verdict in mind.
docs.snippet: When it comes to cases asking the Supreme Court to invalidate the new health care law, the justices seem likely to keep history's verdict in mind.

docs.lead_paragraph: David Frum* has been fired by the American Enterprise Institute; one has to assume that this is a response to his outspokenness about the Republican failure on health reform.

headline.main: David Frum, AEI, Heritage And Health Care

docs.abstract: Obamacare: it's a conservative plan (but they don't want you to know.)
docs.snippet: Obamacare: it's a conservative plan (but they don't want you to know.)

docs.lead_paragraph: IOWA CITY -- President Obama spent plenty of time in Iowa as a candidate. On Thursday, he had a little homecoming of sorts, making a surprise visit to the Prairie Lights bookstore, a business he had referred to during a campaign-style rally just an hour earlier.

headline.main: Obama Stops to Browse at a Bookstore

docs.abstract: President Obama browsed at a bookstore in Iowa City and made a few purchases for his daughters and his press secretary's son.
docs.snippet: President Obama browsed at a bookstore in Iowa City and made a few purchases for his daughters and his press secretary's son.

docs.lead_paragraph: There's a new meme running around which claims that the deficit-reduction estimates for health reform are bogus because Democrats gamed the CBO. What feeds into this perception is the delay in implementing reform, with most of the program not kicking in until 2014. How serious a concern is this?
docs.abstract: Delays in the health care plan aren't hiding any deficit gimmicks.
docs.snippet: Delays in the health care plan aren't hiding any deficit gimmicks.

docs.lead_paragraph: Following is the second set of responses from Michele LoBianco, who teaches "Recession Proofing Your Career" at the School of Continuing and Professional Studies at New York University.

headline.main: Answers From a Career Counselor, Part 2

docs.abstract: Taking Questions: Michele LoBianco, an independent career consultant, coach and facilitator, responds to readers.
docs.snippet: Taking Questions: Michele LoBianco, an independent career consultant, coach and facilitator, responds to readers.

docs.lead_paragraph: With the finish line in sight, Senator John D. Rockefeller IV seems pretty happy about the status of the health care debate. And he wasn't afraid to talk about it this morning.

headline.main: Democrats Praise Health Care Law's Benefits

docs.abstract: A certain senator from West Virginia talked so long that a colleague reminded him that his audience was getting antsy.
docs.snippet: A certain senator from West Virginia talked so long that a colleague reminded him that his audience was getting antsy.

docs.lead_paragraph: After running through an obstacle course of Republican amendments and procedural objections, the Senate on Thursday afternoon approved of a package of changes to the Democrats' sweeping health care overhaul, capping a bitter partisan battle over the most far-reaching social legislation in nearly half a century.
docs.abstract: The Senate passed the health care reconciliation bill, which must return to the House for another vote.
docs.snippet: The Senate passed the health care reconciliation bill, which must return to the House for another vote.
